Description: Limestone ostracon: on the recto seven lines of a business text containing a list of priced objects given by the workman Amenwa. On the verso some trial strokes of the brush.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: S. Birch, 'Inscriptions in the Hieratic and Demotic Character, from the Collections of the British Museum' (London, 1868), pl. XVI; J. J. Černy and A.H. Gardiner, ‘Hieratic Ostraca’ (Oxford 1957), p. 23 and pl. LXXXVI, 4; J.J. Janssen, 'Commodity Prices from the Ramessid Period' (Leiden, 1975), p. 80; K. Kitchen, 'Ramesside Inscriptions Vl' (Oxford 1983), 374. R.J. Demarée, Ramesside Ostraca (London, 2002), 18, pls. 29-30.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (136356) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/136356)
Exhibition history: 2015, 19th June - 5th Sept. Wrexham County Borough Museum. Egyptian Written Culture. 2016 12 Mar-8 May, Carlisle, Tullie House, Writing for Eternity 2016 20 May-4 Sept, The Salisbury Museum, Writing for Eternity 2016 16 Sept-10 Jan 2017, Abergavenny Museum, Writing for Eternity 2017 21 Jan-21 May, Museum of Hartlepool, Writing for Eternity
